moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field.
moves.shortDesc: Prevents the target from switching out.

moves.name: Spit Up
moves.desc: Power is equal to 100 times the user's Stockpile count. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 0. Whether or not this move is successful, the user's Defense and Special Defense decrease by as many stages as Stockpile had increased them, and the user's Stockpile count resets to 0.
moves.shortDesc: More power with more uses of Stockpile.

moves.name: Spite
moves.desc: Causes the target's last move used to lose 4 PP. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if it no longer knows the move.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the PP of the target's last move by 4.

moves.name: Splash
moves.shortDesc: No competitive use.

moves.name: Splintered Stormshards
moves.desc: Ends the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain.
moves.shortDesc: Ends the effects of terrain.

moves.name: Splishy Splash
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Spore
moves.shortDesc: Causes the target to fall asleep.

moves.name: Spotlight
moves.desc: Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from opponents of the target are redirected to the target. Such attacks are redirected to the target before they can be reflected by Magic Coat or the Magic Bounce Ability, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod or Storm Drain Abilities. Fails if it is not a Double Battle or Battle Royal.
moves.shortDesc: Target's foes' moves are redirected to it this turn.

moves.name: Springtide Storm
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to lower the foe(s) Attack by 1.

moves.name: Stealth Rock
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Rock type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any Pokemon uses Tidy Up, or if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
moves.shortDesc: Hurts foes on switch-in. Factors Rock weakness.

moves.name: Steam Eruption
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to burn the target. The target thaws out if it is frozen.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to burn the target. Thaws target.

moves.name: Steamroller
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Steel Beam
moves.desc: Whether or not this move is successful and even if it would cause fainting, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded up, unless the user has the Magic Guard Ability.
moves.shortDesc: User loses 50% max HP.

moves.name: Steel Roller
moves.desc: Fails if there is no terrain active. Ends the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain.
moves.shortDesc: Fails if there is no terrain active. Ends the terrain.

moves.name: Steel Wing
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1.

moves.name: Sticky Web
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, lowering the Speed by 1 stage of each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Can be removed from the opposing side if any Pokemon uses Tidy Up, or if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers Speed of grounded foes by 1 on switch-in.

moves.name: Stockpile
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage. The user's Stockpile count increases by 1. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 3. The user's Stockpile count is reset to 0 when it is no longer active.
moves.shortDesc: Raises user's Defense, Sp. Def by 1. Max 3 uses.

moves.name: Stoked Sparksurfer
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Stomp
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Stomping Tantrum
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user's last move on the previous turn, including moves called by other moves or those used through Instruct, Magic Coat, Snatch, or the Dancer or Magic Bounce Abilities, failed to do any of its normal effects, not including damage from an unsuccessful High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, or Mind Blown, or if the user was prevented from moving by any effect other than recharging or Sky Drop. A move that was blocked by Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, Spiky Shield, Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard will not double this move's power, nor will Bounce or Fly ending early due to the effect of Gravity, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles if the user's last move failed.

moves.name: Stone Axe
moves.desc: If this move is successful, it sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Rock type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any Pokemon uses Tidy Up, or if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
moves.shortDesc: Sets Stealth Rock on the target's side.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
moves.shortDesc: High critical hit ratio.

moves.name: Stored Power
moves.desc: Power is equal to 20+(X*20), where X is the user's total stat stage changes that are greater than 0.
moves.shortDesc: + 20 power for each of the user's stat boosts.

moves.name: Storm Throw
moves.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
moves.shortDesc: Always results in a critical hit.

moves.name: Strange Steam
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Strength
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Strength Sap
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage. The user restores its HP equal to the target's Attack stat calculated with its stat stage before this move was used. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. Fails if the target's Attack stat stage is -6.
moves.shortDesc: User heals HP=target's Atk stat. Lowers Atk by 1.

moves.name: String Shot
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the foe(s) Speed by 2.

moves.name: Struggle
moves.desc: Deals typeless damage to a random opposing Pokemon. If this move was successful, the user loses 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded half up, and the Rock Head Ability does not prevent this. This move is automatically used if none of the user's known moves can be selected.
moves.shortDesc: User loses 1/4 of its max HP.

moves.name: Struggle Bug
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the foe(s) Sp. Atk by 1.

moves.name: Stuff Cheeks
moves.desc: This move cannot be selected unless the user is holding a Berry. The user eats its Berry and raises its Defense by 2 stages. This effect is not prevented by the Klutz or Unnerve Abilities, or the effects of Embargo or Magic Room. Fails if the user is not holding a Berry.
moves.shortDesc: Must hold Berry to use. User eats Berry, Def +2.

moves.name: Stun Spore
moves.desc: Paralyzes the target.
moves.shortDesc: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Submission
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.desc: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it, if the user switches out or faints, or if any Pokemon uses Tidy Up. Baton Pass can be used to transfer the substitute to an ally, and the substitute will keep its remaining HP. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by other Pokemon. Sound-based moves and Pokemon with the Infiltrator Ability ignore substitutes. The user still takes normal damage from weather and status effects while behind its substitute. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the user will take damage from any remaining hits. If a substitute is created while the user is trapped by a binding move, the binding effect ends immediately. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute without fainting, or if it already has a substitute.
moves.shortDesc: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a substitute.

moves.name: Subzero Slammer
moves.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.desc: Fails if the target did not select a physical attack, special attack, or Me First for use this turn, or if the target moves before the user.
moves.shortDesc: Usually goes first. Fails if target is not attacking.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Sunny Day. The damage of Fire-type attacks is multiplied by 1.5 and the damage of Water-type attacks is multiplied by 0.5 during the effect. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Heat Rock. Fails if the current weather is Sunny Day.
moves.shortDesc: For 5 turns, intense sunlight powers Fire moves.

moves.name: Sunsteel Strike
moves.desc: This move and its effects ignore the Abilities of other Pokemon.
moves.shortDesc: Ignores the Abilities of other Pokemon.

moves.name: Supercell Slam
moves.desc: If this attack is not successful, the user loses half of its maximum HP, rounded down, as crash damage. Pokemon with the Magic Guard Ability are unaffected by crash damage. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
moves.shortDesc: User is hurt by 50% of its max HP if it misses.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to half of its current HP, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Does damage equal to 1/2 target's current HP.

moves.name: Superpower
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1.

moves.name: Supersonic
moves.shortDesc: Causes the target to become confused.

moves.name: Supersonic Skystrike
moves.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Surf
moves.desc: Damage doubles if the target is using Dive.
moves.shortDesc: Hits adjacent Pokemon. Double damage on Dive.

moves.name: Surging Strikes
moves.desc: Hits three times. This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
moves.shortDesc: Always results in a critical hit. Hits 3 times.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.desc: Raises the target's Attack by 2 stages and confuses it.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the target's Attack by 2 and confuses it.

moves.name: Swallow
moves.desc: The user restores its HP based on its Stockpile count. Restores 1/4 of its maximum HP if it's 1, 1/2 of its maximum HP if it's 2, both rounded half down, and all of its HP if it's 3. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 0. The user's Defense and Special Defense decrease by as many stages as Stockpile had increased them, and the user's Stockpile count resets to 0.
moves.shortDesc: Heals the user based on uses of Stockpile.

moves.name: Sweet Kiss
moves.shortDesc: Causes the target to become confused.

moves.name: Sweet Scent
moves.desc: Lowers the target's evasiveness by 2 stages.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the foe(s) evasiveness by 2.

moves.name: Swift
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.
moves.shortDesc: This move does not check accuracy. Hits foes.

moves.name: Switcheroo
moves.desc: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.
moves.shortDesc: User switches its held item with the target's.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack by 2 stages.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the user's Attack by 2.

moves.name: Synchronoise
moves.desc: The target is immune if it does not share a type with the user.
moves.shortDesc: Hits adjacent Pokemon sharing the user's type.

moves.name: Synthesis
moves.desc: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if Delta Stream or no weather conditions are in effect or if the user is holding Utility Umbrella, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, or Snow, all rounded half down.
moves.shortDesc: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

moves.name: Syrup Bomb
moves.desc: If this move is successful, it causes the target's Speed to be lowered by 1 stage at the end of each turn for 3 turns.
moves.shortDesc: Target's Speed is lowered by 1 stage for 3 turns.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Tachyon Cutter
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. This move does not check accuracy.
moves.shortDesc: Hits twice. This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Tail Glow
moves.desc: Raises the user's Special Attack by 3 stages.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the user's Sp. Atk by 3.

moves.name: Tail Slap
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the user is holding Loaded Dice, this move will hit 4-5 times.
moves.shortDesc: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Tail Whip
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the foe(s) Defense by 1.

moves.name: Tailwind
moves.desc: For 4 turns, the user and its party members have their Speed doubled. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's side.
moves.shortDesc: For 4 turns, allies' Speed is doubled.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Take Heart
moves.desc: The user cures its non-volatile status condition. Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Cures user's status, raises Sp. Atk, Sp. Def by 1.

moves.name: Tar Shot
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage. Until the target switches out, the effectiveness of Fire-type moves is doubled against it.
moves.shortDesc: Target gets -1 Spe and becomes weaker to Fire.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.desc: Prevents the target from using non-damaging moves for its next three turns. Pokemon with the Oblivious Ability or protected by the Aroma Veil Ability are immune.
moves.shortDesc: Target can't use status moves its next 3 turns.

moves.name: Tearful Look
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk by 1.

moves.name: Teatime
moves.desc: All active Pokemon consume their held Berries. This effect is not prevented by substitutes, the Klutz or Unnerve Abilities, or the effects of Embargo or Magic Room. Fails if no active Pokemon is holding a Berry.
moves.shortDesc: All active Pokemon consume held Berries.

moves.name: Techno Blast
moves.desc: This move's type depends on the user's held Drive.
moves.shortDesc: Type varies based on the held Drive.

moves.name: Tectonic Rage
moves.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Teeter Dance
moves.desc: Causes the target to become confused.
moves.shortDesc: Confuses adjacent Pokemon.

moves.name: Telekinesis
moves.desc: For 3 turns, the target cannot avoid any attacks made against it, other than OHKO moves, as long as it remains active. During the effect, the target is immune to Ground-type attacks and the effects of Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web, and the Arena Trap Ability as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will gain the effect. Ingrain, Smack Down, Thousand Arrows, and Iron Ball override this move if the target is under any of their effects. Fails if the target is already under this effect or the effects of Ingrain, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows. The target is immune to this move on use if its species is Diglett, Dugtrio, Alolan Diglett, Alolan Dugtrio, Sandygast, Palossand, or Gengar while Mega-Evolved. Mega Gengar cannot be under this effect by any means.
moves.shortDesc: For 3 turns, target floats but moves can't miss it.

moves.name: Teleport
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members.
moves.shortDesc: User switches out.

moves.name: Temper Flare
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user's last move on the previous turn, including moves called by other moves or those used through Instruct, Magic Coat, Snatch, or the Dancer or Magic Bounce Abilities, failed to do any of its normal effects, not including damage from an unsuccessful High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, or Mind Blown, or if the user was prevented from moving by any effect other than recharging or Sky Drop. A move that was blocked by Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, Spiky Shield, Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard will not double this move's power, nor will Bounce or Fly ending early due to the effect of Gravity, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles if the user's last move failed.

moves.name: Tera Blast
moves.desc: If the user is Terastallized, this move becomes a physical attack if the user's Attack is greater than its Special Attack, including stat stage changes, and this move's type becomes the same as the user's Tera Type. In addition, if the user's Tera Type is Stellar, this move has 100 power, is super effective against Terastallized targets and neutral against other targets, and lowers the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: If Terastallized: Phys. if Atk > SpA, type = Tera.

moves.name: Tera Starstorm
moves.desc: If the user is a Terapagos in Stellar Form, this move's type becomes Stellar, hits all opposing Pokemon, and becomes a physical attack if the user's Attack is greater than its Special Attack, including stat stage changes.
moves.shortDesc: Terapagos-Stellar: Stellar type, hits both foes.

moves.name: Terrain Pulse
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user is grounded and a terrain is active, and this move's type changes to match. Electric type during Electric Terrain, Grass type during Grassy Terrain, Fairy type during Misty Terrain, and Psychic type during Psychic Terrain.
moves.shortDesc: User on terrain: power doubles, type varies.

moves.name: Thief
moves.desc: If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Z-Crystal, or if the target is a Kyogre holding a Blue Orb, a Groudon holding a Red Orb, a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb, an Arceus holding a Plate, a Genesect holding a Drive, a Silvally holding a Memory, or a Pokemon that can Mega Evolve holding the Mega Stone for its species. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.
moves.shortDesc: If the user has no item, it steals the target's.

moves.name: Thousand Arrows
moves.desc: This move can hit airborne Pokemon, which includes Flying-type Pokemon, Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, Pokemon holding an Air Balloon, and Pokemon under the effect of Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. If the target is a Flying type and is not already grounded, this move deals neutral damage regardless of its other type(s). This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop. If this move hits a target under the effect of Bounce, Fly, Magnet Rise, or Telekinesis, the effect ends. If the target is a Flying type that has not used Roost this turn or a Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, it loses its immunity to Ground-type attacks and the Arena Trap Ability as long as it remains active. During the effect, Magnet Rise fails for the target and Telekinesis fails against the target.
moves.shortDesc: Grounds adjacent foes. First hit neutral on Flying.

moves.name: Thousand Waves
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field.
moves.shortDesc: Hits adjacent foes. Prevents them from switching.

moves.name: Thrash
moves.desc: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused immediately after its move on the last turn of the effect if it is not already. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. If the user is prevented from moving, is asleep at the beginning of a turn, or the attack is not successful against the target on the first turn of the effect or the second turn of a three-turn effect, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk and the user is asleep, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.
moves.shortDesc: Lasts 2-3 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

moves.name: Throat Chop
moves.desc: For 2 turns, the target cannot use sound-based moves.
moves.shortDesc: For 2 turns, the target cannot use sound moves.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop. If the weather is Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, this move's accuracy is 50%. If this move is used against a Pokemon holding Utility Umbrella, this move's accuracy remains at 70%.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to paralyze. Can't miss in rain.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Thunder Cage
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
moves.shortDesc: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Thunderclap
moves.desc: Fails if the target did not select a physical attack, special attack, or Me First for use this turn, or if the target moves before the user.
moves.shortDesc: Usually goes first. Fails if target is not attacking.

moves.name: Thunder Fang
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to paralyze. 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Thunderous Kick
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Thunder Shock
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.desc: Paralyzes the target. This move does not ignore type immunity.
moves.shortDesc: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Tickle
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1.

moves.name: Tidy Up
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1 stage. Removes substitutes from all active Pokemon and ends the effects of Spikes, Stealth Rock, Sticky Web, and Toxic Spikes for both sides.
moves.shortDesc: User +1 Atk, Spe. Clears all substitutes/hazards.

moves.name: Topsy-Turvy
moves.desc: The target's positive stat stages become negative and vice versa. Fails if all of the target's stat stages are 0.
moves.shortDesc: Inverts the target's stat stages.

moves.name: Torch Song
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to raise the user's Sp. Atk by 1.

moves.name: Torment
moves.desc: Prevents the target from selecting the same move for use two turns in a row. This effect ends when the target is no longer active.
moves.shortDesc: Target can't select the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.desc: Badly poisons the target. If a Poison-type Pokemon uses this move, the target cannot avoid the attack, even if the target is in the middle of a two-turn move.
moves.shortDesc: Badly poisons the target. Poison types can't miss.

moves.name: Toxic Spikes
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, poisoning each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Can be used up to two times before failing. Opposing Pokemon become poisoned with one layer and badly poisoned with two layers. Can be removed from the opposing side if any Pokemon uses Tidy Up, or if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, is hit by Defog, or a grounded Poison-type Pokemon switches in. Safeguard prevents the opposing party from being poisoned on switch-in, but a substitute does not.
moves.shortDesc: Poisons grounded foes on switch-in. Max 2 layers.

moves.name: Toxic Thread
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage and poisons it.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 and poisons it.

moves.name: Trailblaze
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1.

moves.name: Transform
moves.desc: The user transforms into the target. The target's current stats, stat stages, types, moves, Ability, weight, gender, and sprite are copied. The user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP, with a maximum of 5 PP each. The user can no longer change formes if it would have the ability to do so. This move fails if it hits a substitute, if either the user or the target is already transformed, or if either is behind an Illusion.
moves.shortDesc: Copies target's stats, moves, types, and Ability.

moves.name: Tri Attack
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to either burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to paralyze or burn or freeze target.

moves.name: Trick
moves.desc: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.
moves.shortDesc: User switches its held item with the target's.

moves.name: Trick-or-Treat
moves.desc: Causes the Ghost type to be added to the target, effectively making it have two or three types. Fails if the target is already a Ghost type. If Forest's Curse adds a type to the target, it replaces the type added by this move and vice versa.
moves.shortDesc: Adds Ghost to the target's type(s).

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the Speed of every Pokemon is recalculated for the purposes of determining turn order. During the effect, each Pokemon's Speed is considered to be (10000 - its normal Speed), and if this value is greater than 8191, 8192 is subtracted from it. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.
moves.shortDesc: Goes last. For 5 turns, turn order is reversed.

moves.name: Triple Arrows
moves.desc: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage, a 30% chance to make it flinch, and a higher chance for a critical hit.
moves.shortDesc: High crit. Target: 50% -1 Defense, 30% flinch.

moves.name: Triple Axel
moves.desc: Hits three times. Power increases to 40 for the second hit and 60 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit three times.
moves.shortDesc: Hits 3 times. Each hit can miss, but power rises.

moves.name: Triple Dive
moves.desc: Hits three times.
moves.shortDesc: Hits 3 times.

moves.name: Triple Kick
moves.desc: Hits three times. Power increases to 20 for the second hit and 30 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit three times.
moves.shortDesc: Hits 3 times. Each hit can miss, but power rises.

moves.name: Trop Kick
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1.

moves.name: Trump Card
moves.desc: The power of this move is based on the amount of PP remaining after normal PP reduction and the Pressure Ability resolve. 200 power for 0 PP, 80 power for 1 PP, 60 power for 2 PP, 50 power for 3 PP, and 40 power for 4 or more PP.
moves.shortDesc: More power the fewer PP this move has left.

moves.name: Twin Beam
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.
moves.shortDesc: Hits 2 times in one turn.

moves.name: Twineedle
moves.desc: Hits twice, with each hit having a 20% chance to poison the target. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.
moves.shortDesc: Hits 2 times. Each hit has 20% chance to poison.

moves.name: Twinkle Tackle
moves.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Twister
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch. Power doubles if the target is using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the foe(s) flinch.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.
moves.shortDesc: User switches out after damaging the target.

moves.name: Upper Hand
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to make the target flinch. Fails if the target did not select a priority move for use this turn, or if the target moves before the user.
moves.shortDesc: 100% flinch. Fails unless target using priority.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.desc: The user spends three turns locked into this move. This move targets an opponent at random on each turn. On the first of the three turns, all sleeping active Pokemon wake up. During the three turns, no active Pokemon can fall asleep by any means, and Pokemon switched in during the effect do not wake up. If the user is prevented from moving or the attack is not successful against the target during one of the turns, the effect ends.
moves.shortDesc: Lasts 3 turns. Active Pokemon cannot fall asleep.

moves.name: Vacuum Wave
moves.desc: No additional effect.
moves.shortDesc: Usually goes first.

moves.name: V-create
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Speed, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Defense, Sp. Def, Speed by 1.

moves.name: Veevee Volley
moves.desc: Power is equal to the greater of (user's Happiness * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.
moves.shortDesc: Max happiness: 102 power. Can't miss.

moves.name: Venom Drench
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 1 stage if the target is poisoned. Fails if the target is not poisoned.
moves.shortDesc: Lowers Atk/Sp. Atk/Speed of poisoned foes by 1.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.desc: Power doubles if the target is poisoned.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles if the target is poisoned.

moves.name: Victory Dance
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, Speed by 1.

moves.name: Vine Whip
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Vise Grip
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Vital Throw
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.
moves.shortDesc: This move does not check accuracy. Goes last.

moves.name: Volt Switch
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.
moves.shortDesc: User switches out after damaging the target.

moves.name: Volt Tackle
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 33% recoil. 10% chance to paralyze target.

moves.name: Wake-Up Slap
moves.desc: Power doubles if the target is asleep. If the user has not fainted, the target wakes up.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles if target is asleep, and wakes it.

moves.name: Waterfall
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Water Gun
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Water Pledge
moves.desc: If one of the user's allies chose to use Fire Pledge or Grass Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Fire Pledge, the ally uses Water Pledge with 150 power and a rainbow appears on the user's side for 4 turns, which doubles secondary effect chances and stacks with the Serene Grace Ability, except effects that cause flinching can only have their chance doubled once. If combined with Grass Pledge, the ally uses Grass Pledge with 150 power and a swamp appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which quarters the Speed of each Pokemon on that side. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Water Gem, and cannot be redirected by the Storm Drain Ability.
moves.shortDesc: Use with Grass or Fire Pledge for added effect.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Water Shuriken
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the user is an Ash-Greninja with the Battle Bond Ability, this move has a power of 20 and always hits three times. If the user is holding Loaded Dice, this move will hit 4-5 times.
moves.shortDesc: Usually goes first. Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Water Sport
moves.desc: For 5 turns, all Fire-type attacks used by any active Pokemon have their power multiplied by 0.33. Fails if this effect is already active.
moves.shortDesc: For 5 turns, Fire-type attacks have 1/3 power.

moves.name: Water Spout
moves.desc: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.
moves.shortDesc: Less power as user's HP decreases. Hits foe(s).

moves.name: Wave Crash
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 33% recoil.

moves.name: Weather Ball
moves.desc: Power doubles if a weather condition other than Delta Stream is active, and this move's type changes to match. Ice type during Snow, Water type during Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, Rock type during Sandstorm, and Fire type during Desolate Land or Sunny Day. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella and uses Weather Ball during Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Desolate Land, or Sunny Day, this move remains Normal type and does not double in power.
moves.shortDesc: Power doubles and type varies in each weather.

moves.name: Whirlpool
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
moves.shortDesc: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Whirlwind
moves.desc: The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, or if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability.
moves.shortDesc: Forces the target to switch to a random ally.

moves.name: Wicked Blow
moves.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
moves.shortDesc: Always results in a critical hit.

moves.name: Wicked Torque
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to cause the target to fall asleep.
moves.shortDesc: 10% chance to cause the target to fall asleep.

moves.name: Wide Guard
moves.desc: The user and its party members are protected from moves made by other Pokemon, including allies, during this turn that target all adjacent foes or all adjacent Pokemon. This move modifies the same 1/X chance of being successful used by other protection moves, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used, but does not use the chance to check for failure. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Burning Bulwark, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn or if this move is already in effect for the user's side.
moves.shortDesc: Protects allies from multi-target moves this turn.

moves.name: Wildbolt Storm
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to paralyze the target. If the weather is Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If this move is used against a Pokemon holding Utility Umbrella, this move's accuracy remains at 80%.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to paralyze foe(s). Rain: can't miss.

moves.name: Wild Charge
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Will-O-Wisp
moves.desc: Burns the target.
moves.shortDesc: Burns the target.

moves.name: Wing Attack
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Wish
moves.desc: At the end of the next turn, the Pokemon at the user's position has 1/2 of the user's maximum HP restored to it, rounded down. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's position.
moves.shortDesc: Next turn, 50% of the user's max HP is restored.

moves.name: Withdraw
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the user's Defense by 1.

moves.name: Wonder Room
moves.desc: For 5 turns, all active Pokemon have their Defense and Special Defense stats swapped. Stat stage changes are unaffected. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.
moves.shortDesc: For 5 turns, all Defense and Sp. Def stats switch.

moves.name: Wood Hammer
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
moves.shortDesc: Has 33% recoil.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Raises the user's Attack and Sp. Atk by 1.

moves.name: Worry Seed
moves.desc: Causes the target's Ability to become Insomnia. Fails if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Ice Face, Insomnia, Multitype, Power Construct, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Tera Shift, Truant, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.
moves.shortDesc: The target's Ability becomes Insomnia.

moves.name: Wrap
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
moves.shortDesc: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Wring Out
moves.desc: Power is equal to 120 * (target's current HP / target's maximum HP), rounded half down, but not less than 1.
moves.shortDesc: More power the more HP the target has left.

moves.name: X-Scissor
moves.shortDesc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep at the end of the next turn. Fails when used if the target cannot fall asleep or if it already has a non-volatile status condition. At the end of the next turn, if the target is still active, does not have a non-volatile status condition, and can fall asleep, it falls asleep. If the target becomes affected, this effect cannot be prevented by Safeguard or a substitute, or by falling asleep and waking up during the effect.
moves.shortDesc: Puts the target to sleep after 1 turn.

moves.name: Zap Cannon
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortDesc: 100% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Zing Zap
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Zippy Zap
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's evasion by 1 stage.
moves.shortDesc: Goes first. Raises user's evasion by 1.
